intro: Aspicarpa guaranitica var. vulgaris, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons. The plant produces small, star-shaped fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its vines can grow up to several meters in length. The fruit is often used in local cuisine and has a mild, sweet flavor.
